page.title: 08Todays Railway.
page.content: Nowadays, Class 50's and 33's go through the tunnel and over the viaduct.Sometimes a 125 - or H.S.T comes through Gillingham because of track work on the main line.Class 47's pull fertiliser trains and twice a day a ballast train comes through.In the signal box is a board which lights up when a train is coming.The paper train stops at 01.00hrs.Gillinghams earliest passenger train is at 04.20 and has about 9 carriages, while the latest is at 10.30.Sometimes a special excursion train comes in at midnight. In about 1950 the track was changed to single track and is still so today. It is only a double track through the station. Sometimes a deisel multiple unit comes through, to the delight of the many keen train spotters.
